data.scheme_name: Uttar Pradesh Textile and Garmenting Policy 2022 - Incentives for promotion of Silk Industry - General/OBC - New
data.benefits:
15% capital subsidy for rearing of chaaki worm, koya production, reeling and spinning in sericulture on investment up to Rs. 100 lakhs

20% capital subsidy to silk reeling units with investments more than Rs. 100 lakhs

Silk reeling units producing 75% threads from koya produced in state, will be provided interest subsidy @5% on working capital loan for 5 years. The upper limit of this subsidy is Rs. 0.5 lakhs per annum.
data.eligibility: All new textile and garmenting units setting up after or on the date of announcement of policy.
data.conditions: Benefit will be provided in addition to the State Government’s share in the schemes of Government of India and/or CSB.
data.beneficiaries: All new textile and garmenting units setting up after or on the date of announcement of policy.
data.prerequisites: Benefit will be provided in addition to the State Government’s share in the schemes of Government of India and/or CSB.
data.nodal_agency: Directorate of Textile, Department of Textile
data.context: The Uttar Pradesh Textile and Garmenting Policy 2022 aims to boost the textile and garment industry in the state. It was introduced to attract investments, create jobs, and position Uttar Pradesh as a leading hub for textile and apparel manufacturing.
data.objective:
a) Attract investment in the textile and apparel sector to the tune of Rs. 10,000 Crore.

b) Generate employment opportunity for 5 lakh persons.

c) Development of five (05) Textile and Apparel Parks through private sector.

d) 50% increase in earnings of Handloom and Power loom weavers. 

e) Modernization of power looms and their operation through solar energy.

f) Increase production of silk yarn in the state.
data.description:
a) Units for rearing of chaaki worm, koya production, reeling and spinning in sericulture sector,

with a maximum capital investment of Rs. 100 lakhs, that take loan from banks/financial institutions, will be eligible for capital subsidy to the tune of 15% for margin money. The margin money will be calculated based upon appraisal of project cost done by the Bank. 

b) Capital subsidy of 20% will be given to silk reeling units requiring a capital investment of Rs. 100 lakhs or more, in addition to subsidy from Government of India institutions such as the Central Silk Board. 

c) Subsidy will be provided in addition to the State Government’s share in the schemes of Government of India and/or CSB. 

d) Working Capital Subsidy: Silk reeling units which produce minimum 75% thread from koya produced in Uttar Pradesh will be eligible for interest subsidy at the rate of 5% on Working Capital Loan for a period of 5 years. The maximum limit of this will be Rs 0.5 lakhs per annum.
data.how_to_apply: Scheme can be applied through Nivesh Mitra Portal of Uttar Pradesh Government.
data.funding_facilitator: Directorate of Textile, Department of Textile
data.funding_mechanism: The beneficiary will get the benefit after the approval of application by the funding facilitator.
data.highlights: The Department of Handloom and Textiles, Government of Uttar Pradesh shall appoint a team of professionals as Project Management Agency (PMA) for policy implementation and supporting the department in publicizing the policy benefits among national / international investors, brands and other stakeholders and providing prompt support to the investors.
data.additional_info: Preference will be given to those resident/s, in purchase of land from UPSIDA, GIDA, NOIDA, GREATER NOIDA or other authorities, to start new employment.
